author: mode
msg: Fix for checking for mandatory attributes for tags like jsp:include jsp:forward etc.

author: rubys

author: rubys
msg: Fixing the snoop example to use <%= %> instead, since the XML
equivalents are not fully cooked yet and should not be used in the
examples.
Submitted by: Danno Ferrin <shemnon@earthlink.net>

author: rubys
msg: s/jsp:expr/jsp:expression/g
Note: I'm presuming that as a reference implementation, spec compliance
takes priority over backwards compatibility.  If anybody sees a need to
support the <jsp:expr tags, let me know and I will add them.
Note: this change did not introduce any regressions in any of the watchdog
jsp tests.  This is quite surprising in itself.
Submitted by: Hans Bergesten <hans@gefionsoftware.com>

author: rubys
msg: Infrastructure and error recovery in preparation for scripting support
With this change, <jsp:scriptlet > is accepted (note the white space) and
<jsp scriptlet runat="server"> produces an error.
Also, every ParseEventListener method is now passed a Hashtable of
attributes with the exception of handleComment.  This facilitates
rapid response to JSP spec changes, and will enable future tag libraries
to reuse more of the current Jasper implementation.
No regressions were noted in watchdog jsp tests as a result of this change.
